title: Sébastien Lecornu - Wikipedia
snippet: Lecornu was appointed Prime Minister on 9 September 2025 by President Emmanuel Macron. He succeeded François Bayrou, who was forced to resign on the same day following the failure of a vote of confidence in the National Assembly the day before. title: Opinion | France Needs a New France - The New York Times
snippet: Designed for Charles de Gaulle in 1958, in the midst of the Algerian War, it broke with previous parliamentary setups to endow presidents with stunning constitutional prerogatives: the ability to dissolve the National Assembly, the authority ...

title: Lecornu lives to fight another day, but the outlook for France remains bleak – POLITICO
snippet: While Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu was working toward a deal with the Socialists in his country’s fractured National Assembly, the 34 centrist lawmakers of Philippe’s Horizons party unceremoniously announced they would abstain or oppose the government in a key vote on the social security budget set to be held Tuesday evening.

title: Macron names ally Sébastien Lecornu as new French PM
snippet: President Emmanuel Macron has named close ally Sébastien Lecornu as the new French prime minister, 24 hours after a vote of confidence ousted François Bayrou as head of government.

title: Prime Minister of France - Wikipedia
snippet: The current prime minister of France is Sébastien Lecornu who was appointed on 9 September 2025 and resigned on 6 October 2025, but was re-appointed on 10 October.
